Topic.Title: Overbought???

Message.Msg: i have read these posts for a while. never actually posted. ashraff has admitted (at the most important times) when he was down that it has been a frustrating wait. those that don't like his research and insight sound angry. but his comments, even though he is long the stock, are rather objective. if it does settle in, it will probably hold $14. But it will definitely hold $13. there was years of resistance there, it took several attempts to go through that level, and now it has the 50 and 200 day converging to that level if it were to pull back. (but it won't...... the fundamentals are undoubtedly improving). and one more side note, anyone that points to the revenues this quarter or guidance for next quarter, clearly doesnt understand the transition from Tegra 3 or the magnitude of management's tremendous decision to pull forward the 4i to become a player in a new, gigantic market (smartphones). dont buy if u dont want, but shorting this particular company makes no sense...........

Message.Title: "New Nexus 7 to be highlight of Google I/O as 'iPad mini 2' faces delay, analyst says"
Message.Msg: "New Nexus 7 to be highlight of Google I/O as 'iPad mini 2' faces delay, analyst says" "Noted analyst Ming-Chi Kuo believes Google will unveil a next-generation Nexus 7 tablet in partnership with Asus at the search giant's upcoming Google I/O conference, looking to steal some of Apple's thunder as a next-generation iPad mini is rumored to be delayed. ... "As for major changes from the current Nexus 7, Kuo sees a switch to Qualcomm's Snapdragon S4 Pro processor, a 7-inch LTPS panel carrying a 1,980-by-1,200 pixel resolution, a 5-megapixel rear facing camera and the inclusion of Texas Instruments' Qi wireless charging. " Source: appleinsider

Message.Title: "Qualcomm Surges 28%; World's 4th largest IC company."
Message.Msg: "Qualcomm Surges 28%; World's 4th largest IC company." "Qualcomm became the world’s fourth largest supplier of ICs in Q1, growing sales 28% in Q1 2013 compared to Q1 2012 to knock Toshiba into 5th place in the world semiconductor rankings, reports IC Insights. Next quarter Micron should complete its takeover of Elpida which would, if it had been done this quarter, have propelledd the company into fifth place behind Qualcomm with $3bn of revenues. TSMC is in third place. This means, of course, that a lot of sales are double-counted, but IC Insights points out that it sees the list as a supplier list not a marketshare list." source: electronicsweekly

Message.Title: "Play$tation 4: Sony announces the PS4 won’t be sold at loss"
Message.Msg: "When Sony built the PS3, it pulled out all the stops. The console had a custom-built processor based on a new architecture that IBM, Sony, and Toshiba jointly invested $400 million in developing." .. "By 2005 standards, the PS3 was incredible — and it lost money like a sieve leaks water. iSuppli estimated that Sony lost $306.85 on every single low-end ($499) PS3 it sold, with the high-end, $599 SKU costing the company $241.35. It took Sony nearly four years to start making money on the PS3′s hardware, a fact the company has been anxious to avoid this time around." source: extremetch

Topic.Title: If I sold paper bags I could make a fortune on the Nvidia board.

Message.Msg: So if you bought your AMD, just over 12 months ago (beginning of May 2012) you would have paid $8, and now it's worth $4.20 for an almost 50% drop. What exactly are you going on about? Some facts for you: In the last year, AMD GPU sales were down, but they say that's because the PC business is declining. Yet NVIDIA just announced GPU sales up 8% Y to Y. NVIDIA is building a campus with spare cash AMD just sold their Austin campus to make sure they have enough money to finish the year. I admire AMD, they have brought a lot of tech to the x86 market (such as 64 bit), and competition for Intel and NVIDIA is good. But as an investment, based on facts, they look pretty shaky to me. I know AMD has created another rough spot for themselves in GPU with their well documented issues with studder and runt frames (look at PC Perspectives if you are so clueless as to not know what this is about). Is your frustration with AMD driving you to post endless fact less derogatory statements? Or are you paid to do this? Honestly I am curious, as I can't figure out any reason other than employment and mental illness that wold cause someone to spend so much time posting the same old tired stuff as you do.

Topic.Title: If I sold paper bags I could make a fortune on the Nvidia board.

Message.Msg: There was nothing BS in my post. It is a fact; Just about 12 months ago AMD was at $8 per share. Since you seem a bit slow, so let me explain slowly. The point there is that you can pick convent time periods to show a NVIDIA price drop, I can pick the same for AMD. What matters is going forward, and the facts I listed are relevant to theses companies future. I say "if" to illustrate a hypothetical situation. It's a common thing among adults. Now if I wanted to be more emotional, and fact less (like you) I'd assume all AMD fans bought their stock above 8$ a share (just like you like to assume that all NVIDIA supporters bought theirs 16 or 26 or whatever servers you at the time. You know the saying about assumptions, or maybe you would not.. Maybe you have been posting bs for so long you can't tell the difference. I just stop by here from time to time to see what is here (have for 10 years), and am saddened to see how low some (such as yourself) degrade the quality of discussion here. As I asked before, I can't understand why you spend so much time here posting such nonsense, unless: 1) you are paid to do so. Which I find it hard to believe that posts such as yours really influence anything, so who would pay for that. 2) You are a deranged AMD fan. Yea, I know runt frames and all, it's a tough year for the AMD GPU guys. But there's no need for these childish outbursts of yours.
